page.title: 02Radio Station, Kesgrave
page.content: We interviewed two of the American service staff from the transmitter station. The station is where it is because there were already four towers there from the war; it saved money to use them instead of building more. Each tower has two dishes. It has been used as a transmitter station since 1963. The station is manned 24 hours a day by the 72 people who work there, working 8-hour shifts. The station's main use is to send radio signals all over England and even further. The workers wear different uniforms depending on their job. Some repair the equipment so always wear overalls, others check things so sometimes wear a proper uniform and sometimes overalls. The staff can be sent to other places such as Hong Kong or the United States of America.
